key_terms.definition: Pharmacy board examination

exam_critical_points.point: Understanding pharmacy profession legal requirements

key_terms.definition: Providing pharmaceutical services to promote health, safety and patient welfare, prevent diseases and achieve optimal medication use outcomes

exam_critical_points.point: License requirement
Professional association membership
Recertification

topics.main_topic: Pharmacy Licensure Requirements in Puerto Rico

key_terms.definition: Legal authorization to practice pharmacy in Puerto Rico
Accreditation Council For Pharmacy Education

exam_critical_points.point: Must be 21 years of age
Must have pharmacy degree from accredited institution
1,500 hours internship required
Must pass general and law examination
Recertification every 3 years

key_terms.definition: 1500 hours minimum under licensed pharmacist supervision
Board examination consisting of two parts: General and Legal aspects

exam_critical_points.point: Minimum 500 hours in community pharmacy required
Industrial pharmacy practice limited to 300 continuous hours
Must complete first year of pharmacy school before starting internship

topics.regulatory_context: Puerto Rico Law 247 of 2004 and Board of Pharmacy General Regulations 2014

topics.main_topic: Pharmacy License Requirements in Puerto Rico

key_terms.definition: Colegio de Farmacéuticos de Puerto Rico (Puerto Rico College of Pharmacists)
Process required every 3 years with continuing education requirements

exam_critical_points.point: Must be an active member of CFPR to practice pharmacy in Puerto Rico
35 continuing education credits required
Recertification required every 3 years

topics.regulatory_context: Puerto Rico State Law 243 (1938) and Law 247 (2004)

key_terms.definition: Certificate granted by the Board to authorized pharmacists with specialty certification from recognized professional agencies
Additional certifications like Vaccine Administration, Compounding, Nuclear Pharmacy

exam_critical_points.point: Pharmacists must have Board certification to advertise as specialists
All special certifications must be renewed every 3 years
Renewal date synchronized with pharmacist's birthday

topics.main_topic: Pharmacist Recertification Requirements for Inactive Status

key_terms.definition: Pharmacists not practicing for more than 3 years without completing CE requirements
Required hours based on length of inactivity period

exam_critical_points.point: 3 year inactivity threshold
Practice hours based on inactive period

key_terms.definition: Must request 90 days before first day of professional's birth month
Pharmacy Law (3 credits), Medication Errors (3 credits), Pharmaceutical Ethics (3 credits), Infection Control (3 credits)

exam_critical_points.point: 90-day advance filing requirement
Required documentation includes CE units evidence, ASUME certification, Criminal Background Check
Fines of $100-$500 for delays

key_terms.definition: Conducta que va contra la moral y ética profesional
Obtención de licencia mediante medios fraudulentos

exam_critical_points.point: Convicción por delitos en los últimos 10 años
Adicción a sustancias controladas
Incapacidad mental declarada por tribunal

key_terms.definition: Process of reinstating a pharmacy license after suspension
Treatment program required for rehabilitation

exam_critical_points.point: Board may require participation in treatment program for license reinstatement
License can be reinstated after proving recovery from addiction

key_terms.definition: Ley que describe las principales funciones del farmacéutico
Farmacoterapia mediante protocolo

exam_critical_points.point: Autoridad para dispensar medicamentos con receta
Necesidad de certificado para vacunar

key_terms.definition: The process of evaluating, preparing, and providing medication to a patient with appropriate counseling
The act of giving medications via oral, topical, intranasal, subcutaneous or intramuscular routes by certified pharmacists

exam_critical_points.point: Pharmacist must personally provide counseling unless patient explicitly declines
Certification required for medication administration
Intravenous administration not permitted by pharmacists

key_terms.definition: Pharmacy technician must be supervised by authorized pharmacist when administering vaccines
Required for vaccinating patients aged 3-11 years for certain vaccines

exam_critical_points.point: Age restrictions for different vaccine types
Pharmacy technician certification requirements
Special requirements for dengue vaccine

key_terms.definition: Farmacéutico responsable cuyo nombre aparece en los récords del Departamento de Salud
Velar por el cumplimiento de leyes como miembro de un equipo

exam_critical_points.point: Debe aparecer registrado en el Departamento de Salud
Responsable del cumplimiento de leyes de manufactura, distribución y dispensación

key_terms.definition: Licensed pharmacist who serves as the responsible pharmacist for a facility
Requirement that a pharmacist can only serve as regente in one establishment at a time

exam_critical_points.point: Pharmacist regente required in pharmacies, drug wholesalers, and pharmaceutical manufacturing plants
Can only serve as regente in one establishment

topics.main_topic: Pharmacy Preceptor and Practice Site Requirements

key_terms.definition: Physical presence of pharmacist in prescription area or immediate work area
Licensed pharmacist certified by Board with 3+ years experience who supervises interns

exam_critical_points.point: Pharmacist can supervise max 5 people total: 5 technicians OR 1 pharmacy intern + 4 technicians
Preceptor must have minimum 3 years experience
Practice site must be licensed pharmacy compliant with applicable laws

key_terms.definition: Licensed pharmacist authorized to inspect and examine documentation and activities subject to licenses, certificates and special authorizations

exam_critical_points.point: Must be licensed by Puerto Rico Board of Pharmacy
Must maintain current professional registration
Has authority to inspect 8 different types of facilities

key_terms.definition: Certificate issued by the Board to authorized pharmacists with specialty certification from recognized professional agencies
Legal framework governing pharmacy certifications and credentials

exam_critical_points.point: Pharmacists cannot advertise or claim specialist status without Board certification
Board can certify specialists in pharmacy practice areas

key_terms.definition: Término no mayor de 6 meses
No excederá de $5,000

exam_critical_points.point: Ejercer como farmacéutico sin licencia
Emplear personas sin licencia de farmacia

key_terms.definition: Minor offenses in pharmacy practice
Immediate oversight by licensed pharmacist

exam_critical_points.point: Operating without proper licenses/permits
Dispensing without licensed pharmacist supervision
Single employee operation concerns

key_terms.definition: Authorized medical prescriber including physicians, dentists, podiatrists, and veterinarians
Medical samples in original packaging and labeling

exam_critical_points.point: Illegal to dispense prescriptions from unauthorized prescribers
Prescribers cannot directly dispense medications except original samples
Prohibited financial relationships between prescribers and pharmacies

key_terms.definition: Operating a pharmacy, drugstore, or pharmaceutical facility without required licenses and certifications
Selling prescription medications without valid prescription from authorized healthcare provider

exam_critical_points.point: Must have proper licensing to operate any pharmaceutical facility
Prescription medications require valid prescription from authorized provider
Cannot sell to unlicensed facilities

key_terms.definition: pharmacy establishment
bioequivalent medications

exam_critical_points.point: Unauthorized use of pharmacy-related terms in advertising
Improper medication exchange practices
Non-compliant vaccine administration

key_terms.definition: Beneficios financieros recibidos a cambio de prescribir medicamentos específicos
Medicamentos que demuestran equivalencia con el medicamento de referencia

exam_critical_points.point: Es ilegal que médicos o entidades médicas reciban incentivos por prescribir medicamentos específicos
La prohibición aplica a todos los tipos de medicamentos (genéricos, biosimilares, marca)

key_terms.definition: Serious crime involving obstruction of pharmacy inspectors
Using force or intimidation to prevent pharmacy inspectors from performing their duties

exam_critical_points.point: One year imprisonment penalty for obstructing pharmacy inspectors
Applies to obstruction of document review and facility inspections

key_terms.definition: Legal entity including associations, societies, and corporations representing themselves or their members
Not to exceed 60 days for pharmacy technician license

exam_critical_points.point: Maximum suspension period of 60 days
Legal standing for economic interest parties

key_terms.definition: Requerimiento de que el técnico trabaje bajo supervisión del farmacéutico autorizado
Tareas delegadas que no requieren juicio profesional farmacéutico

exam_critical_points.point: El técnico debe estar siempre bajo supervisión directa del farmacéutico
No puede verificar recetas ni orientar sobre medicamentos

key_terms.definition: Required credential to practice as a pharmacy technician in Puerto Rico
Process of renewing pharmacy technician credentials

exam_critical_points.point: Must obtain certification to practice
Must maintain active certification through recertification

topics.main_topic: Requisitos para Técnico de Farmacia en Puerto Rico

key_terms.definition: Credencial oficial requerida para ejercer como técnico de farmacia en Puerto Rico
Práctica supervisada requerida como parte del proceso de certificación

exam_critical_points.point: Edad mínima de 18 años
Certificado Negativo de Antecedentes Penales requerido
Graduación de escuela superior obligatoria
Aprobación de curso de técnico de farmacia acreditado

topics.main_topic: Pharmacy Technician Certification Requirements in Puerto Rico

key_terms.definition: National certification board that administers pharmacy technician examinations
Licensed pharmacist who supervises pharmacy technician interns

exam_critical_points.point: Completion of required practice hours under pharmacist supervision
Written examination covering pharmaceutical mathematics, pharmacotherapy, technical aspects, administrative and legal aspects
Must complete internship before requesting board examination

topics.main_topic: Pharmacy Technician Recertification Requirements in Puerto Rico

key_terms.definition: 2.0 UEC (20 hours) per three-year period required
Legal grounds for denying pharmacy technician certification

exam_critical_points.point: 2.0 UEC (20 hours) continuing education requirement per triennium
Six specific grounds for certificate denial
10-year lookback period for moral turpitude convictions

key_terms.definition: Temporary removal of pharmacy practice privileges
Regulated drugs requiring special handling and documentation

exam_critical_points.point: Addiction to controlled substances or alcohol is grounds for suspension
False testimony or fraud in obtaining license
Rehabilitation program participation may allow license reinstatement

key_terms.definition: Oversight by licensed pharmacist during technician duties
Authority to administer recommended vaccines under pharmacist supervision

exam_critical_points.point: Must complete CPR certification
1 hour annual immunization continuing education required
Cannot verify prescriptions or provide patient counseling

key_terms.definition: Temporary absence of pharmacist for emergency reasons, limited to 2 hours maximum
Patient's written declaration declining pharmacist consultation

exam_critical_points.point: Maximum 2-hour limit for pharmacist absence
Technicians can only dispense pre-verified prescriptions
Documentation required in Absence Registry

key_terms.definition: Organismo regulador compuesto por 7 miembros nombrados por el gobernador

exam_critical_points.point: 7 miembros totales (6 farmacéuticos y 1 técnico)
Mínimo 3 miembros de farmacia comunitaria
Término de 4 años
Máximo 2 términos consecutivos
No pueden ser dueños/directores de instituciones educativas de farmacia

topics.main_topic: Facultad (Powers and Duties of the Pharmacy Board)

key_terms.definition: Legal powers and duties of the pharmacy board
Pharmacy internship program

exam_critical_points.point: Board has exclusive power to regulate pharmacy profession
Board can authorize, deny, suspend or revoke licenses
Board manages certification of both pharmacists and pharmacy technicians

topics.main_topic: Facultad (Powers and Duties of the Board)

key_terms.definition: Examining Officers who may be delegated powers by the Board
Formal complaint that can initiate investigations

exam_critical_points.point: Board can approve and establish rules for pharmacy practice
Board can initiate investigations independently or by formal complaint
Board can summon witnesses and seek court assistance

key_terms.definition: Authorization from Secretary to acquire, sell or dispense medications and devices
Designated pharmacist responsible for prescription department

exam_critical_points.point: Must have at least one pharmacist present during operating hours
Security measures for medication handling and storage required
Minimum equipment and reference materials needed

key_terms.definition: Designated prescription dispensing area
Only permitted in emergency cases with visible notice

exam_critical_points.point: Must have dedicated prescription dispensing area
Must have private patient consultation area
Pharmacist absence only allowed in emergencies

key_terms.definition: Temporary absence of pharmacist limited to 2 hours maximum
Maximum of 5 technicians or 1 intern plus 4 technicians under one pharmacist

exam_critical_points.point: 2-hour maximum absence limit
Maximum supervision ratio of 5 personnel per pharmacist
Documentation required in Absence Registry

key_terms.definition: Physical presence of pharmacist in prescription area with personal verification of work
Temporary relocation permit during declared emergencies

exam_critical_points.point: Maximum 4 people under pharmacist supervision for dispensing activities
Patients have right to free pharmacy selection
Physicians cannot direct patients to specific pharmacies

key_terms.definition: Valid for 2 years from date of issuance
Valid for 3 years for medication/biological product registration

exam_critical_points.point: Separate license required for each establishment
Licenses are non-transferable
Secretary has exclusive power to grant/deny/suspend/cancel licenses

key_terms.definition: License to maintain and administer medications in specific institutional settings
Triennial registration required for medication management

exam_critical_points.point: Medications can only be administered on-site, not dispensed for later use
Registration must be renewed every 3 years by February 15
Educational institutions conducting FDA-approved clinical trials are exempt from botiquin license

key_terms.definition: Lead pharmacist responsible for regulatory compliance
Multidisciplinary team ensuring compliance

exam_critical_points.point: Manufacturing facilities must have one or more pharmacists except oxygen/medical gas manufacturers
Wholesale distributors must have at least one pharmacist supervising medication distribution

key_terms.definition: Farmacéutico responsable registrado en el Departamento de Salud que vela por el cumplimiento de leyes relacionadas con medicamentos

exam_critical_points.point: Debe estar registrado en el Departamento de Salud
Responsable del cumplimiento de leyes de manufactura, distribución y dispensación

key_terms.definition: Supervising pharmacist required to oversee pharmacy operations
Restricted area limited to authorized personnel for dispensing medications

exam_critical_points.point: Regente can only supervise one establishment at a time
Facilities requiring Regente include pharmacies, drug wholesalers, and pharmaceutical manufacturers
Limited access to prescription areas except for authorized personnel

key_terms.definition: Temporary absence of pharmacist only permitted in emergency situations
Two hour maximum when pharmacist is absent

exam_critical_points.point: Must post visible notice of pharmacist absence
24-hour notification requirement to Division of Medicines and Pharmacies
Technicians can only dispense pre-verified prescriptions during absence

key_terms.definition: Special log book for recording pharmacist meal breaks
Supervising pharmacist for interns/technicians

exam_critical_points.point: Pharmacist must record departure and return times for meals
Breaks under 60 minutes don't require posting notice
No dispensing allowed by interns/technicians without preceptor present

key_terms.definition: Timeframe within which employment changes must be reported
Required format for reporting employment changes to Division of Medications and Pharmacy

exam_critical_points.point: Must notify Division of Medications and Pharmacy within 3 days of pharmacist employment changes
Both owners/administrators and pharmacists must report employment changes
Changes in work schedule must also be reported

key_terms.definition: Designated physical space in pharmacy for providing pharmaceutical services
Private space for patient counseling and medication education

exam_critical_points.point: Must have security system/alarm for after-hours protection
Must be separated from tobacco and alcohol sales areas
Must provide private consultation space

key_terms.definition: Sign or display indicating pharmacy services
Criminal offense for unauthorized pharmacy signage

exam_critical_points.point: Cannot display pharmacy-related terms without proper license
Prohibited terms include farmacia, droguería, botica, pharmacy, drugstore

subtopics: Medicamentos con requisitos especiales (Special requirement medications)

key_terms.definition: Controlled substances requiring special handling
Licensed pharmacist authorized to dispense medications

exam_critical_points.point: OTC medications with controlled substances can only be purchased at pharmacies
Prescription medications must be dispensed only by pharmacists in registered pharmacies
Pharmacy technicians can only dispense under direct pharmacist supervision

key_terms.definition: Medicamentos que requieren requisitos especiales para su dispensación

exam_critical_points.point: Las disposiciones locales sobre productos biológicos deben armonizar con leyes y reglamentos federales
La FDA tiene autoridad regulatoria sobre productos biológicos en Puerto Rico

key_terms.definition: Biological product highly similar to reference product
Biosimilar that may be substituted for reference product

exam_critical_points.point: Automatic substitution of biological products is prohibited
Pharmacist can only substitute if product is FDA approved as interchangeable

key_terms.definition: Prescriber indication prohibiting substitution
Reference biological medication that may be substituted

exam_critical_points.point: 2-day notification requirement to prescriber
Must inform patient of substitution right and right to refuse
Electronic documentation of specific product dispensed

topics.main_topic: Electronic Health Record System and Biological Product Substitution

key_terms.definition: The act of replacing a prescribed biological reference product with an alternative biological product
Documentation in pharmacy system accessible to prescriber

exam_critical_points.point: Pharmacist must notify prescriber of biological product substitution
Notification exemptions for unavailable products and refills

key_terms.definition: FDA database listing biological products including biosimilar and interchangeable products
Biological product highly similar to reference product

exam_critical_points.point: 3-year documentation retention requirement
Prescriber notification of substitution
Purple Book verification mandatory

key_terms.definition: 3-11 years for most vaccines, 3+ years for COVID-19/Influenza
Required for vaccines in 3-11 age group and dengue vaccine at any age

exam_critical_points.point: Cannot administer vaccines to children under 3 years
Dengue vaccine requires medical order regardless of age
COVID-19 and Influenza vaccines allowed for 3+ years

topics.main_topic: Prescription Medication Definition under Puerto Rico Pharmacy Law

key_terms.definition: Medication that Puerto Rico or US laws require to be dispensed only with a prescription by a licensed pharmacist in a registered pharmacy
Original written order issued and signed by an authorized healthcare professional for dispensing medications or devices

exam_critical_points.point: Must be dispensed by licensed pharmacist in registered pharmacy
Veterinary medications can be dispensed by licensed veterinarians
Authorized prescribers include physicians, dentists, podiatrists, and veterinarians

key_terms.definition: Written or oral order from a licensed practitioner that must be dispensed by a pharmacist
Mandatory professional relationship required for prescription validity

exam_critical_points.point: Prescriptions must come from licensed practitioners in Puerto Rico or any US state
Original prescription required for controlled substances
Electronic prescriptions from medical offices are considered original prescriptions

topics.regulatory_context: Puerto Rico Pharmacy Law and FDCA

key_terms.definition: Medication samples identified by manufacturer, delivered in original packaging and labeling, in limited quantities without commercial transaction
Prescription transmitted by prescriber to pharmacy through system authenticating electronic signature and ensuring transmission security

exam_critical_points.point: Community pharmacies cannot possess prescription drug samples
Medical samples cannot be sold, bought, or negotiated
Only authorized professionals can distribute medical samples to patients

key_terms.definition: Situation requiring immediate medication administration where written prescription cannot be reasonably obtained beforehand
Maximum time allowed for prescriber to submit original prescription in emergency cases

exam_critical_points.point: Pharmacist must transcribe oral prescription upon receipt
Original prescription must be marked 'EMERGENCIA'
Emergency prescriptions limited to 5-day supply
Special laws apply for controlled substances

key_terms.definition: One year from date of issuance for non-controlled substances
Pharmacist may complete missing patient information after verification

exam_critical_points.point: Pharmacist must document corrections on back of prescription with date, time, communication method, and source
One year validity period except for controlled substances
Special rules apply for controlled substances prescriptions

topics.regulatory_context: Puerto Rico Pharmacy Law and DEA Regulations

key_terms.definition: Must be dispensed within 2 days of issue date, no refills allowed
May be refilled up to 5 times within 6 months with prescriber authorization

exam_critical_points.point: CII prescriptions cannot be refilled without new prescription
Refills must be documented on original prescription or patient record
Prescriptions can be transferred between pharmacies sharing database

topics.regulatory_context: Puerto Rico Narcotic Law, Durham-Humphrey Amendment, DEA Regulations

topics.main_topic: 30-Day Prescription Refills Between Pharmacies with Shared Databases

key_terms.definition: Electronic system that allows multiple pharmacies to access the same prescription and patient records
Standard dispensing period for prescription medications

exam_critical_points.point: Prescriptions for more than 30 days can be split into 30-day supplies
Dispensing between shared-database pharmacies is not considered a transfer
Patients may choose any pharmacy within shared network for refills

key_terms.definition: Right to refuse dispensing based on professional judgment regarding errors, legal compliance, or patient safety
Right to refuse dispensing based on personal, ethical, religious or moral convictions

exam_critical_points.point: Pharmacist must sign bottom right of prescription to assume responsibility
No legal obligation to dispense all prescriptions unless state law requires

topics.main_topic: Responsabilidad por la dispensación de una receta (HIPAA 1996)

key_terms.definition: Tutor legal, pariente o persona natural de 18 años o más designada por el paciente
Medicamentos que han cambiado de color, olor o textura, o tienen envases/etiquetas dañadas

exam_critical_points.point: No dispensar medicamentos expirados
Farmacéutico responsable de verificar requisitos legales
Separar medicamentos dañados en área específica

key_terms.definition: All information obtained during pharmacist-patient relationship expected to remain private, including protected health information
Required person-to-person counseling between pharmacist and patient/representative

exam_critical_points.point: Counseling must be person-to-person unless explicitly declined by patient
Documentation of counseling/decline must be maintained for 2 years
Confidential information can only be shared with authorized parties

key_terms.definition: Prescription belongs to patient until dispensed
Minimum 2 years from dispensing date

exam_critical_points.point: Prescriptions must be stored securely for minimum 2 years
Patients have right to prescription copy marked with 'Copy'
Original prescription belongs to patient until dispensed

key_terms.definition: FDA's Approved Drug Products with Therapeutic Equivalence Evaluations
Product with therapeutic equivalence recognized by FDA

exam_critical_points.point: No returns of correctly dispensed prescription medications
Expiration dating for compounded products - 14 days for aqueous preparations
Bioequivalent must have 'A' coding in Orange Book

key_terms.definition: Registro del paciente donde se documentan los intercambios de medicamentos

exam_critical_points.point: El farmacéutico debe anotar la fecha del intercambio en el expediente o receta
Los medicamentos que salen del recetario no pueden ser devueltos

key_terms.definition: Oficial responsable de hacer cumplir y fiscalizar las disposiciones de la Ley
Entidad que puede iniciar investigaciones contra farmacéuticos y técnicos

exam_critical_points.point: El Secretario puede investigar, inspeccionar y citar testigos
La Junta puede investigar por iniciativa propia o por querella formal

topics.main_topic: Division of Medications and Pharmacy (División de Medicamentos y Farmacia)

key_terms.definition: Secretaría Auxiliar de Reglamentación y Acreditación de Facilidades de Salud
Pharmacist with minimum 5 years professional experience

exam_critical_points.point: Authority to inspect records, documents, inventories, and premises
Annual reporting requirements for wholesale distributors
Authority to seize non-registered or unfit medications

key_terms.definition: Drugs determined by society to require stricter regulation due to abuse potential
Legal framework where only registered entities can manufacture, distribute and dispense controlled substances

exam_critical_points.point: Only registered entities can legally handle controlled substances
System designed to prevent diversion to illicit markets

topics.regulatory_context: DEA and Puerto Rico Controlled Substances Regulations

key_terms.definition: High abuse potential, no accepted medical use, cannot be prescribed except for research
High abuse potential, accepted medical use with severe restrictions

exam_critical_points.point: Schedule I drugs cannot be manufactured, prescribed or dispensed except for research
Each schedule has specific criteria regarding abuse potential and medical use

key_terms.definition: Controlled substances with low abuse potential including benzodiazepines, chloral hydrate, chlordiazepoxide, phenobarbital, phentermine, carisoprodol, tramadol
Controlled substances with lowest abuse potential, including codeine-containing antitussives and antidiarrheal opioid products

exam_critical_points.point: Separate registration required for each business activity
Federal registration renewal every year for manufacturers/distributors
Dispensers must renew registration every 3 years

topics.regulatory_context: DEA and Puerto Rico Controlled Substances Regulations

key_terms.definition: Representante de fabricante, distribuidor o dispensador de sustancias controladas que actúa en curso normal de negocio
Sistemas y equipos requeridos para proteger sustancias controladas incluyendo rejas, cámaras y alarmas

exam_critical_points.point: Exención aplica a agentes actuando en curso normal de negocio
Requisito de cámaras en áreas específicas: recetario, entrega, recibo y almacenaje
Sistemas de alarma obligatorios para detectar entradas fuera de horario

topics.regulatory_context: DEA and Puerto Rico Pharmacy Law

key_terms.definition: Written protocol for use, handling, control and security of controlled substances that must be submitted during registration and reviewed every 2 years
Storage unit weighing at least 750 lbs that must be bolted or embedded to the floor for CI and CII substances

exam_critical_points.point: CI and CII substances must be stored in 750lb+ secured safe
CIII-CV substances can be dispersed among non-controlled inventory
Cannot employ persons convicted of controlled substance felonies

key_terms.definition: Loss of controlled substances that must be evaluated based on quantity, drug type, business patterns and specific circumstances
Loss occurring during shipping before pharmacy takes custody

exam_critical_points.point: Report losses to DEA within 1 business day of discovery
Report losses to Puerto Rico Office of Investigations within 5 calendar days
Supplier responsible for transit losses before pharmacy custody

topics.regulatory_context: DEA and Puerto Rico Controlled Substances Regulations

key_terms.definition: Medical professional, dentist, veterinarian or podiatrist authorized to practice and registered in Puerto Rico
Valid medical reason for prescribing controlled substances within normal professional practice

exam_critical_points.point: Must be DEA registered or exempt under CSA
Prescription must be for legitimate medical purpose
Shared responsibility between prescriber and pharmacist

topics.regulatory_context: DEA and Puerto Rico Controlled Substances Regulations

topics.main_topic: Shared Responsibility in Controlled Substance Prescribing

key_terms.definition: Includes what the pharmacist knows and should have known based on circumstantial evidence and obvious facts
Physician certified in addiction psychiatry or medicine with special DEA registration

exam_critical_points.point: Pharmacists must verify prescriptions are for legitimate medical purpose
Prescribers need special DEA registration for opioid addiction treatment

key_terms.definition: Process by which pharmacists can modify certain prescription elements after consulting with prescriber
Required printed summary including warnings and side effects for controlled substances

exam_critical_points.point: Pharmacists can correct patient address and dosing information with prescriber approval
Cannot modify patient name, controlled substance, or prescriber signature
Must provide printed information summary to patients

topics.regulatory_context: DEA and Puerto Rico Controlled Substances Law

key_terms.definition: Dispensing CII medications without written prescription in emergency situations with oral authorization
Condition requiring immediate administration with no alternative treatment and impossible to obtain written prescription

exam_critical_points.point: 7-day written prescription requirement after emergency dispensing
DEA notification required if written prescription not received within 7 days
Emergency dispensing quantity limited to emergency period only

key_terms.definition: Instalaciones de Cuidado Prolongado donde se permite dispensación parcial
Entrega fraccionada de medicamentos controlados

exam_critical_points.point: 60 días límite para dispensación parcial CII en casos LTC/terminales
6 meses límite para dispensar CIII-CIV desde fecha expedición
2 días límite para narcóticos en Puerto Rico

topics.regulatory_context: DEA and Puerto Rico State Law

key_terms.definition: Receta generada y transmitida electrónicamente por prescribiente registrado, con firma electrónica autenticada
Hasta 5 veces en 6 meses desde expedición

exam_critical_points.point: Documentación requerida para repeticiones: fecha, cantidad, iniciales del farmacéutico
Sistemas electrónicos deben mantener historial completo de dispensaciones

topics.regulatory_context: DEA and Puerto Rico Department of Health

key_terms.definition: Official form required for ordering Schedule II controlled substances
Complete inventory required every two years

exam_critical_points.point: Schedule II records must be maintained separately
Records must be maintained for 2 years
Initial inventory required before beginning operations

topics.main_topic: Pharmacy Record Keeping and Reverse Distribution

key_terms.definition: Registered entities that collect and dispose of unusable or expired controlled substances from other registrants
DEA-approved methods for organizing prescriptions either in 2 or 3 separate files

exam_critical_points.point: Must maintain separate files for CII prescriptions
Expired controlled substances must be returned within 6 months
CIII-V prescriptions must be marked with red 'C' if filed with non-controls

topics.regulatory_context: DEA and Puerto Rico Health Department Regulation 153

key_terms.definition: Serious infractions related to controlled substance handling and reporting
Requirement to report discrepancies within 5 calendar days

exam_critical_points.point: Separate filing requirements for CII vs CIII-CV
Two-year record retention requirement
Mandatory reporting of ownership/location changes

key_terms.definition: Medicamentos regulados que requieren registro y control especial
Documento oficial que autoriza el manejo de sustancias controladas

exam_critical_points.point: Notificación obligatoria de empleados adictos
Vencimiento del Certificado de Registro por más de 5 días
Requisitos de etiquetado de medicamentos

topics.regulatory_context: DEA and Puerto Rico Department of Health

topics.main_topic: Colegio de Farmaceuticos de Puerto Rico

key_terms.definition: Professional pharmacy organization in Puerto Rico established by Law 243 of 1938
Professional ethics codes that govern pharmacist conduct

exam_critical_points.point: Authority to adopt and implement ethics codes
Power to investigate sworn complaints against members
